newsitem.title: USA: Shareholders file suit against Avant.
newsitem.headline: Shareholders file suit against Avant.

text.p: Shareholders of Avant! common stock filed a complaint charging the company made fraudulent statements about its use of proprietary software technology, plaintiffs' lawyers said on Monday.

The complaint charges that the company and some of its senior officers failed to disclose adverse information about what it termed "wrongful use" of proprietary software technology from Avant!'s competitor, Cadence Design Systems Inc.
In a statement, lawyers for the stockholders said they sought to recover damages, but did not specify a dollar amount.

The shareholders, who bought common stock in Avant! during the period from March 29, 1996, through April 11, 1997, are represented by Berger & Montague P.C. and Gold Bennett & Cera LLP, the statement said.

According to the lawyers, claims of wrongdoing made by Cadence were met with assurances by Avant! to its shareholders that the case had no merit and would not have a material adverse impact on Avant!'s financial position.

Then, on April 11, the Santa Clara County district attorney's office filed a criminal felony action against Avant! and members of its management charging them with theft of trade secrets and conspiracy, the statement said.
No one was immediately available at Avant! to comment on the case.
